bug.short_desc: Removing vim-minimal package also removes sudo
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I tried to remove `vim-minimal` package in a newly installed Fedora 25 (in order to be install `vim-enchanced`). However this also removed `sudo` package, so that I became unable install or remove anything because I didn't set root password at the installation.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
sudo-1.8.18-1.fc25.x86_64 vim-minimal-2:7.4.1989-2.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible:
sudo yum remove vim-minimal
Actual results:
Removes `vim-minimal` and `sudo` packages.
Expected results:
Removes only `vim-minimal` package, but keeps `sudo` installed.
Additional info:
This is already fixed in rawhide, will be fixed with next sudo update in 25.
